wikipedia_page.main:
Gerald John Melling (1943 – 22 December 2012) was an English-born, architect, poet, novelist, journalist, author and editor.
Gerald Melling came to his craft by an unconventional route and he brings his unique brand of Liverpudlian humor and a fair measure of Beatles'-style anti-establishmentarianism to the poetic little buildings he nurtures.
Following the Boxing Day Tsunami in 2004, he designed almost 50 houses and a community center along the south coast of Sri Lanka, eventually writing a book called Tsunami Box about his experiences.
